title: Taliyah
body: While I enjoyed Taliyah's short little video, I do have a lore concern. Someone explain how Taliyah is going to make it to Shurima without encountering Rek'sai. In Rek'sais lore it explains how people would go hundreds of miles out of their way to avoid running into her, yet Taliyah is clearly going directly in a straight line to Shurima. She isnt flying so Rek should certainly be able to sense Taliyah moving through her killing grounds. Anyone have any theories?

replies.body: Easy. Rek'Sai live in the Sai, which is in southern Shurima. Taliyah went to the Freljord and then went south to get to Shurima, as such she went through northern and central Shurima to reach the capital. As such she would've missed Rek'Sai by hundreds of miles.

Thank you makes more sense now.

Rek'Sai inhabits "The Sai"  it is a particularly harsh desert of loose broken rock but it doesn't even cover a 1/8 of Shurima.    The Sai is one of the largest deserts but it's bordered by several other deserts and dried lakes.

Care if I pick your brain quickly then? (because my largest joy in writing is world-building)

If it barely covers a tiny sliver of Shurima, wouldn't that kinda defeat the "fear" of Rek'sai altogether for the people of Shurima? If they know that she only ranges the Sai, and that entering it is near-certain death, wouldn't the argument be made that they're never going out of their way to avoid it?

Put another way; doesn't it weaken Rek'sai's backstory/fear if she has only a tiny sliver of Shurima to stalk underneath the sands?

1/8th isn't exactly a tiny sliver And Shurima is not exactly small to beginn with.

Depending on the topography the Sai could be coevring several major direct routes in the south of Shurim andcut off a large chunk of the land behind it, as well as large stretches of the rest of southern valoran.
